gov.nih.nci.hl7.ui.nodeloader
Interface NodeLoader

All Known Implementing Classes:
DBMBasicTreeNodeLoader, DBMMapSourceNodeLoader, DBMMapTargetNodeLoader, DefaultNodeLoader, FunctionMetaNodeLoader, HSMBasicNodeLoader, HSMMapTargetNodeLoader, HSMTreeNodeLoader, SCMBasicNodeLoader, SCMMapSourceNodeLoader, SCMTreeNodeLoader
public interface NodeLoader

This defines the interface that a node loader needs to deliver.

Version:
Since caAdapter v1.2 revision $Revision: 1.1 $ date $Date: 2006-10-03 17:36:25 $
Author:
OWNER: Scott Jiang, LAST UPDATE $Author: marwahah $

Nested Class Summary
static class NodeLoader.MetaDataloadException
          Load meta data load Exception
 
Method Summary
 javax.swing.tree.TreeNode loadData(java.lang.Object o)
          Based on the given object type, this function will convert the meta-data tree to a TreeNode-based tree structure, whose root is the returned TreeNode.
 java.lang.Object unLoadData(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode treeNode, boolean resetUUID)
          Given the node as the root of UI tree structure, this function will traverse the UI tree structure and construct a user object tree structure and return the root of the meta-data user object tree.
 

Method Detail

loadData

javax.swing.tree.TreeNode loadData(java.lang.Object o)
                                   throws NodeLoader.MetaDataloadException
Based on the given object type, this function will convert the meta-data tree to a TreeNode-based tree structure, whose root is the returned TreeNode.

Parameters:
o - the meta-data object
Returns:
the root node representing the TreeNode structure mapping the given meta-data tree.
Throws:
NodeLoader.MetaDataloadException

unLoadData

java.lang.Object unLoadData(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode treeNode,
                            boolean resetUUID)
                            throws NodeLoader.MetaDataloadException
Given the node as the root of UI tree structure, this function will traverse the UI tree structure and construct a user object tree structure and return the root of the meta-data user object tree.

Parameters:
treeNode - the root of the sub-tree to be processed.
resetUUID - if true, will tell loader to reset UUID field; otherwise, it will keep existing UUID; The reason to have the option is that the original data may come from another CSV metadata file and UUIDs of those data should be re-assigned before being persisted.
Returns:
the root of the meta-data user object tree.
Throws:
NodeLoader.MetaDataloadException
